H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H5038.def: = the dead body of humans or animals

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H3978.def: = any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H2623.def: = someone who practices חֶסֶד, who is committed towards fulfilling his/her obligations; these may be obligations defined within the context of a covenant or agreement, or moral obligations to do well to someone who did well to you before

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H8210.def: = causative action by which humans pour out a liquid or dry substance

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H6912.def: = to put the body of someone who died in a designated place, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or in a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, but also with honor and respect

H2781.def: = state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

H3933.def: only used in poetry; = action by which humans express their disdain of others with words, sounds and/or gestures

H7047.def: = action by which someone speaks insulting words to someone else, ◄ out of a sense of superiority, ► intending to bring public shame upon that person

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H599.def: = process by which deities or humans experience an emotion of anger; ◄ caused by someone else's behavior ► almost invariably resulting in punishment for the party that is responsible, and almost exclusively used with God as the subject

H5331.def: poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future

H7068.def: = process by which humans or deities experience a sentiment of anger  for the sake of someone else, ◄ because that other person does not receive the attention, commitment, or treatment that they are entitled to

H1197.def: = process by which someone or something is harmed or destroyed by fire

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H8210.def: = causative action by which humans pour out a liquid or dry substance

H2534.def: = poisonous fluid; ◄ secreted by serpents, scorpions, etc. and introduced into body of victim by bite or sting; ► used by these animals to kill their prey and/or defend themselves against their natural enemies; ≈ often used to denote suffering and injury in a more general sense as well

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H4467.def: = state in which a person or deity has been entrusted with the office of {L:king<SDBH:מֶלֶךְ>} or {L:queen<SDBH:מַלְכָּה>}

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3290.def: = man, also known as {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}; ◄ second son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; ► one of the patriarchs of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

H8074.def: = state in which an area has become empty as a result of destruction and depopulation

H7223.def: = state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H7356.def: = state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well-being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action

H6923.def: = action by which humans place themselves in front of individuals or groups, facing either forward or backward, ► and either with good or with evil intentions; ≈ sometimes used figuratively in situations where humans come before God in worship, or where God confronts enemies, or when certain conditions are personified

H1809.def: = process by which the height of a body of water is diminished ◄ due to a drought

H5826.def: = process by which humans receive assistance or supported from other humans or deities

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3468.def: = a state in which a human or deity helps a human in need to be safe / a safe state

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H3722.def: = causative action by which humans cover objects with a coating of a certain substance

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H346.def: = a reference to an unknown location; normally used with the purpose of finding out which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H5360.def: = action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong and so find relief from their anger

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H8210.def: = causative action by which humans pour out a liquid or dry substance

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H603.def: = act by which humans make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering

H616.def: usually used as collective: = person who is locked up in a prison or other location where one does not have the freedom to act and go at will

H1433.def: = state in which a human being or deity has an elevated status

H2220.def: = each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈  directly associated with strength and power

H3498.def: = state in which humans, animals, or objects remain in a certain place after part of the original quantity has been located elsewhere

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H2436.def: = front of the body of a human being, which, when a person is sitting down, forms a kind of platform that can be used for activities like throwing the lot, and that can even function as a sitting place for someone else, like a pet animal, a child or a beloved one; ≈ symbolizes affection and intimacy, and sometimes represents the entire person

H7659.def: = state in which a countable entity is seven in number

H2781.def: = state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H2778.def: = causative action by which humans make an effort to arouse an emotion of shame in (other) humans or deities; ◄ by their words or actions

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H587.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse, including those associated to him or her

H6629.def: = group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

H4830.def: = open land with enough grass and plants to graze cattle or flocks of sheep and goats

H3034.def: literally: to confess (God's) name; hence: = action by which humans publicly admit their own shortcomings before God, or the shortcomings of the people they represent

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H8416.def: = action by which humans express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to deities about who they are and what they do
